alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 10:55AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Douglas and southeastern Jefferson Counties through 1130 AM MDT... At 1055 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sprucewood, or 29 miles southwest of Denver, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roxborough Park, Sprucewood, South Platte and Buffalo Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
